text: Singles Only is the second EP by Canadian country music band James Barker Band, released on May 24, 2019. Upon its release, Singles Only debuted at number 68 on the Canadian Albums Chart. == Singles == "Good Together" was released as the debut single from the then-upcoming EP in January 2018, and peaked at #6 on the Canadian country radio chart. It went on to become the most-played Canadian song at Canadian country radio in 2018. "Keep It Simple" was released as the second single in January 2019, and went on to hit #1 on the Canadian country radio chart. It was released to American country radio in May 2019. It peaked at 87 on the Canadian Hot 100 and was certified Gold by Music Canada. "There's a Drink for That" was released as the third single to radio to coincide with the EP's release in May 2019, and would peak at #2 on the Canadian country radio chart. "Slow Down Town" was released as the fourth single in February 2020. == Track listing == == Charts == === EP === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2017) ! scope="col"| Peak position |- ! scope="row"| Canadian Albums (Billboard) | 68 |} === Singles === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak positions ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Certifications |- style="font- size:smaller;" ! style="width:4em;"| CAN Country ! style="width:4em;"| CAN |- | 2018 ! scope="row"| "Good Together" | 6 | — | |- | rowspan="2"| 2019 ! scope="row"| "Keep It Simple" | 1 | 87 | * MC: Gold |- ! scope="row"| "There's a Drink for That" | 2 | — | |- | 2020 ! scope="row"| "Slow Down Town" | 21 | — | |} == Awards and nominations == {| class="wikitable" |- !
